name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

key_work.title: Prosthetic Transformations
key_work.brief_description: Odd Studio turn a young woman into a witch through prosthetics and makeup, in process that involves sketching, sculpting, blasting, plastering and painting a variety of materials like silicone, alginate and clay into replicas and moulds that transform actors.

constellations_primary.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

start.title: The Dark Knight
start.creator_credit: Charles Roven, Christopher Nolan, Emma Thomas, Lorne Orleans and Isobel Griffiths
start.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2008
start.brief_description: From the opening sequence to the final frame, Christopher Nolan’s The Dark Knight never wastes a moment. Featuring Heath Ledger’s legendary, Oscar-winning performance as the Joker, action-packed set pieces and philosophical musings not seen in superhero movies, The Dark Knight is one of the best.

constellations_other.name: Big screen dreams
constellations_other.description: With groundbreaking technology and a unique cinema experience, today IMAX theatres are not only loved by audiences but championed by pioneering filmmakers like Christopher Nolan and James Cameron. Yet the route to get there was an unconventional one.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

end.title: The Hours
end.creator_credit: Ian MacNeil, Mark Huffam, Robert Fox and Scott Rudin
end.brief_description: “The Hours” is the story of three women searching for more potent, meaningful lives. Each is alive at a different time and place, all are linked by their yearnings and their fears. Their stories intertwine, and finally come together in a surprising, transcendent moment of shared recognition.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

links.description: Fellow Australian actor Nicole Kidman also won an Academy Award for a performance highly assisted by prosthetics – she was virtually unrecognisable as Virgina Woolf in The Hours.

start.title: The Hours
start.creator_credit: Ian MacNeil, Mark Huffam, Robert Fox and Scott Rudin
start.brief_description: “The Hours” is the story of three women searching for more potent, meaningful lives. Each is alive at a different time and place, all are linked by their yearnings and their fears. Their stories intertwine, and finally come together in a surprising, transcendent moment of shared recognition.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

end.title: Moulin Rouge!
end.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Knapman, Catherine Martin, Fred Baron, Martin Brown, Philip Martin Brown and Steve E. Andrews
end.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 2001
end.brief_description: A celebration of love and creative inspiration takes place in the infamous, gaudy and glamorous Parisian nightclub, at the cusp of the 20th century. A young poet, who is plunged into the heady world of Moulin Rouge, begins a passionate affair with the club’s most notorious and beautiful star.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but their scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

constellations_other.name: Diamonds are still a girl's best friend
constellations_other.description: This constellation explores the continuing cultural impact of Marylin Monroe’s iconic performance of 'Diamonds are a Girl’s Best Friend' in Gentlemen prefer Blondes (1953).

links.description: While Heath Ledger and Nicole Kidman took home Oscars for transformative performances, Catherine Martin has won more Oscars than any Australian for transforming actors through threads and sets. Her first two wins for Costume and Production design were for Moulin Rouge!

start.title: Moulin Rouge!
start.creator_credit: Baz Luhrmann, Catherine Knapman, Catherine Martin, Fred Baron, Martin Brown, Philip Martin Brown and Steve E. Andrews
start.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 2001
start.brief_description: A celebration of love and creative inspiration takes place in the infamous, gaudy and glamorous Parisian nightclub, at the cusp of the 20th century. A young poet, who is plunged into the heady world of Moulin Rouge, begins a passionate affair with the club’s most notorious and beautiful star.

end.title: Some Like It Hot
end.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Billy Wilder, Doane Harrison, United Artists and Michael Logan
end.brief_description: Two musicians witness a mob hit and struggle to find a way out of the city before they are found by the gangsters. Their only opportunity is to join an all-girl band as they leave on a tour.

constellations_primary.name: Some like it hot
constellations_primary.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

links.description: When Martin won her second pair of Oscars for The Great Gatsby, she overtook fellow Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly, who had won three between 1952–60, including one for the Billy Wilder’s classic Some Like it Hot.

start.title: The Hours
start.creator_credit: Ian MacNeil, Mark Huffam, Robert Fox and Scott Rudin
start.brief_description: “The Hours” is the story of three women searching for more potent, meaningful lives. Each is alive at a different time and place, all are linked by their yearnings and their fears. Their stories intertwine, and finally come together in a surprising, transcendent moment of shared recognition.

end.title: The Witches
end.creator_credit: Marit Allen, Mark Shivas, The Jim Henson Company and Warner Bros. Pictures
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1990
end.brief_description: A young boy named Luke and his grandmother go on vacation only to discover their hotel is hosting an international witch convention, where the Grand High Witch is unveiling her master plan to turn all children into mice. Will Luke fall victim to the witches’ plot before he can stop them?

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

links.description: Kidman wore a prosthetic nose while playing Virginia Woolf but it definitely wasn’t as terrifying as the one fellow Oscar-winner Angelica Huston donned in Nicolas Roeg’s adaptation of Roald Dahl’s The Witches.

start.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
start.brief_description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Bursting with stunning practical effects, explosive set pieces and iconic costumes, the original Mad Max trilogy (1979-85) cemented its place in pop culture before roaring back to life 30 years later.

constellations_other.name: Outlaws and the end
constellations_other.description: Tracing connections from Sweet Country to Australian westerns and resistance to white colonial narratives.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

constellations_other.name: Storyboards to Academy Awards
constellations_other.description: Storyboards allow filmmakers, showrunners and game designers to visualise and communicate how their stories will look on-screen.

end.title: Make up/SPFX
end.credit_line:
Edie Kurzer, Australia, 2020

Make-up box with make-up

Courtesy Lee-Anne Donnolley
end.brief_description: In the digital age it’s sometimes easy to overlook the physical crafts of filmmaking. Make-up and prosthetics are vital to the creation of characters in film, television and theatre - bringing werewolves, Terminators and planets full of apes to life.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

links.description: You can find out more about make-up and special effects in artist and costume designer Edie Kurzer’s display in the Federation Square foyer.

start.title: The Witches
start.creator_credit: Marit Allen, Mark Shivas, The Jim Henson Company and Warner Bros. Pictures
start.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1990
start.brief_description: A young boy named Luke and his grandmother go on vacation only to discover their hotel is hosting an international witch convention, where the Grand High Witch is unveiling her master plan to turn all children into mice. Will Luke fall victim to the witches’ plot before he can stop them?

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

end.title: Dinosaurs
end.creator_credit: Brian Henson and Walt Disney Television
end.brief_description: Dinosaurs follows the life of a family of dinosaurs, living in a modern world. They have TV’s, fridges, microwaves, and every modern convenience.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

links.description: The Witches was one of the last films that puppeteer and filmmaker Jim Henson personally oversaw before his death and the effects were done by his company The Creature Shop. Similarly, Henson conceived of the puppet-performed sitcom Dinosaurs a year before his death.

start.title: Mad Max: Fury Road

end.title: The Dark Knight
end.creator_credit: Charles Roven, Christopher Nolan, Emma Thomas, Lorne Orleans and Isobel Griffiths
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2008

Featuring Heath Ledger’s legendary, Oscar-winning performance as the Joker, action-packed set pieces and philosophical musings not seen in superhero movies, The Dark Knight is one of the best.

constellations_other.name: Big screen dreams
constellations_other.description: With groundbreaking technology and a unique cinema experience, today IMAX theatres are not only loved by audiences but championed by pioneering filmmakers like Christopher Nolan and James Cameron. Yet the route to get there was an unconventional one.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

links.description: Like the silicone scars on the War Boys that contributed to Odd Studio’s Oscar win, the prosthetic scars Heath Ledger wore to create the Joker’s savage smile helped the actor’s Oscar-winning transformation into the Crown Prince of Crime in The Dark Knight.

Bursting with stunning practical effects, explosive set pieces and iconic costumes, the original Mad Max trilogy (1979-85) cemented its place in pop culture before roaring back to life 30 years later.

links.description: This cabinet in The Story of the Moving Image shows an Odd Studio team member transforming into a witch through practical make-up and prosthetic effects. In 2016, Odd Studio won the Best Hair and Make Up Academy Award for Mad Max Fury Road.
